li.a: Spanish Translation Pickup and Go Meals
Transportation Alternatives | Walk and Bike to School
Data Dashboard for the Strategic Plan
Middle and High School Continuous Learning

br.b: Kansas Department of Health and Environment: https://govstatus.egov.com/coronavirus

br.span: In an effort to keep members informed, BlueKC is sending updates to members via email. To receive these emails, you must opt in to receive communication from BlueKC. If you are a current BlueKC member and have not been receiving emails from them,
on how to opt in to emails or update your email address with BlueKC.
br.a: Click here to read the contents of an email
br.span: sent by BlueKC on Friday, March 27

cite.span: Are you looking for a way to help with Covid-19 by volunteering? VolunteerMatch has a variety of volunteer opportunities available. Many of the opportunities can be done from you own home. Click the following link for more information.

hr.p: Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Your EAP benefit through New Directions Behavioral Health is free of charge to all employees and their family members. The EAP benefit offers free counseling sessions (at this time, counseling sessions are telephonic, video or via text messaging), financial and legal services. Their website also hosts a wide array of resources. See below for flyers with more details of services offered.
Intro to EAP - Legal Services - Financial Services. - Work-life Services

p.b: Below are five tip sheets on a variety of topics that you might find helpful during uncertain times:

1. 4 Tips for Adjusting to Work from Home
2. Tips for Staying Active While Working From Home

3. Enhancing Emotional Health While Social Distancing
4.

b.a: Remote Work with Children: Best Practices and Resources for Parents

p.b: 5. How to Keep Teams Thriving While Working Remotely

hr.p: Mindfulness apps: Looking for assistance with self care? Some developers are making the premium version of their apps FREE to teachers and other school staff.
Calm: Meditations, sleep stories, movement exercises, journals, and music to help you look after yourself! The links below include their ~free~ resources, as well as their YouTube channel.

Private Facebook group: How to join: search "SMSD Wellbeing: At-home!" and request to join. You will be asked to answer a question (what building you work in). This group is private, so anything you comment, post, like, etc. will only be seen by members of the group and is not posted to your personal Facebook page. Please read the group description and guidelines after being accepted.

br.b: Peloton classes: https://www.onepeloton.com/app **90-day free trial running right now.

br.span: - You do not need the Peloton bike to take their app's free classes!
- Types of classes: Yoga, Strength, Stretching, Bootcamp, and more.
- We have created playlists for different types of workouts and saved our favorite videos!

cite.span: - Use your smsd.org email to sign up.

span.span: - Once you sign up, there are apps for your smartphone, tablet, iPad, etc. Each type of class has its own app. You will use the same login for all apps.

br.span: - Types of classes: Yoga, Beginner Yoga, HIIT, Barre, 7-minute workouts
- Make a FREE account at the above link
- Grokker offers everything from workout videos, cooking videos, mental wellbeing exercises, and more.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

article.h2: Shawnee Mission school buildings are closed through the end of the school year.
